page.title: 09GRAVEL WORKING IN THURGARTON
page.content: The only{industry}in the block is concerned with extracting the{gravels {and sands}deposited by the post ice age waters.The current excavation is on the outskirts of{Thurgarton}by Tarmac Ltd.(who recently bought out the nationally known firm,{Hoveringham {Gravels).}The impression given is that there has been a slow down in the rate of extraction,perhaps reflecting the depressed state of the country's economy and low investment on roads. Many worked-out areas are to be seen locally either in the form of{man-made {lakes}or being filled in and recapped with soil for return to agriculture. A group of lakes in{Bleasby},called the{Jubilee Ponds}is being preserved and developed as a park for local folk A small off-shoot firm at{Thurgarton makes concrete slabs and pipes and has recently developed a new flooring.
